name: BINLookup
description: Perform a BIN (Bank Identification Number) or IIN (Issuer Identification Number) lookup

bin-number.description: The BIN or IIN number. This is the first 6, 8 or 10 digits of a card number, use 8 (or more) digits for the highest level of accuracy

customer-ip.description: Pass in the customers IP address and we will return some extra information about them

$ul: **bin-number**: The BIN or IIN number
**card-brand**: The card brand (e.g. Visa or Mastercard)
**card-category**: The card category. There are many different card categories the most common card categories are: CLASSIC, BUSINESS, CORPORATE, PLATINUM, PREPAID
**card-type**: The card type, will always be one of: DEBIT, CREDIT, CHARGE CARD
**country**: The full country name of the issuer
**country-code**: The ISO 2-letter country code of the issuer
**country-code3**: The ISO 3-letter country code of the issuer
**currency-code**: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country of the issuer
**ip-blocklisted**: True if the customers IP is listed on one of our blocklists, see the IP Blocklist API
**ip-blocklists**: An array of strings indicating which blocklists this IP is listed on
**ip-city**: The city of the customers IP (if detectable)
**ip-country**: The country of the customers IP
**ip-country-code**: The ISO 2-letter country code of the customers IP
**ip-country-code3**: The ISO 3-letter country code of the customers IP
**ip-matches-bin**: True if the customers IP country matches the BIN country
**ip-region**: The region of the customers IP (if detectable)
**is-commercial**: Is this a commercial/business use card
**is-prepaid**: Is this a prepaid or prepaid reloadable card
**issuer**: The card issuer
**issuer-phone**: The card issuers phone number
**issuer-website**: The card issuers website
**valid**: Is this a valid BIN or IIN number
**api-error**: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed
**api-error-msg**: API error message
**api-error**: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed
**api-error-msg**: API error message
**api-error**: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed
**api-error-msg**: API error message
**api-error**: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed
**api-error-msg**: API error message
